subject: RE: [junit] Swing Testing
msgSnippet: Also you might want to look at Jemmy (jemmy.netbeans.org) if you are wanting to create the actions from the actual UI.  You can control the UI components with
messageBody:
Also you might want to look at Jemmy (jemmy.netbeans.org) if you are wanting
to create the actions from the actual UI. You can control the UI components
with Jemmy inside of the JUnit framework.


-----Original Message-----
From: Arvind Sharma [mailto:mailtoarvind@...]
Sent: Friday, December 20, 2002 7:43 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] Swing Testing


Hi,
I am new to junit framework. I want to know what
will be the best way to write test classes for Action
Listeners of a Swing GUI. I mean how do we to test the
objects of Action Listener Classes.

Regards
Arvind
